If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the announcement only includes partial measures, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will Paris experience an increase in luxury hotel bookings for the 2024 Summer Olympics?
body:

1. 'Luxury hotels' are defined as 5-star establishments or those with average nightly rates exceeding €1,000.
2. An 'increase' is defined as a minimum 5% rise in occupancy rates or total bookings for these hotels during the Olympic period.
3. The comparison should be made against the average of the same period (late July to early August) in the three years preceding 2024, excluding any years significantly affected by COVID-19 restrictions.

Confirmation must come from at least two of the following sources:
- Official reports from the Paris Tourism Office or equivalent government body
- Published data from major hotel chains or booking platforms
- Analysis by reputable hospitality industry research firms
- Reports from at least three major international news outlets

The question will resolve as NO if the specified increase is not confirmed by the resolution date, or if reports indicate that luxury hotel bookings have remained stagnant or decreased.

This introduction could include a demonstration run, participation in a race, or any other official on-track activity during a NASCAR-sanctioned event. The introduction must be confirmed by at least two reputable news sources. The question will resolve as NO if no such introduction occurs by the specified date or if NASCAR officially announces that they will not introduce an electric racecar within this timeframe.

If no such landfall occurs by the specified date, or if a tropical storm or depression makes landfall without reaching hurricane strength, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will federal health officials confirm a death linked to recalled microdosing candies by July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, federal health officials officially confirm that recalled microdosing candies were directly linked to at least one death. The confirmation must come from an official statement or report issued by a federal health agency such as the FDA or CDC. The statement should explicitly connect the death to the consumption of the recalled microdosing candies. News reports alone will not be sufficient for a YES resolution; there must be an official confirmation from a federal health agency. If no such confirmation is made by the resolution date, or if officials determine that the candies were not the cause of any deaths, the question will resolve as NO.

If no such resumption occurs by the specified date, or if the tour is officially cancelled rather than resumed, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will Google report a reduction in its emissions by at least 5% for the year 2023 compared to 2022?
body: This question resolves as YES if Google's official Environmental Report for 2023, typically released in mid-2024, shows a reduction in the company's total emissions by at least 5% compared to its 2022 levels. The reduction must be explicitly stated in Google's official report or confirmed by at least two reputable news sources citing the report. If Google does not release its Environmental Report by July 31, 2024, or if the report shows less than a 5% reduction or an increase in emissions, this question resolves as NO. Note that this question is about the emissions data for the year 2023, which is typically reported in the following year.

title: Will Google announce a new major initiative to address AI electricity consumption by July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Google officially announces a new major initiative specifically aimed at addressing the electricity consumption of its AI operations. To qualify, the initiative must be: 1. Officially announced by Google through its corporate channels (e.g., press release, blog post, or official statement). 2. Reported by at least two reputable news sources. 3. Explicitly focused on reducing or optimizing the electricity consumption of AI operations. The initiative should be distinct from Google's existing environmental goals and represent a significant new effort in response to the growing energy demands of AI. Minor updates to existing programs or general sustainability initiatives not specifically targeting AI electricity consumption will not qualify. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the announced initiatives do not meet the above criteria, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will a U.S. federal court uphold a pause on gas export project considerations by July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, a U.S. federal court upholds or allows a pause on the consideration of liquefied natural gas (LNG) export projects. The pause must be initiated by the current presidential administration and must affect multiple LNG export projects. The court decision must be reported by at least two reputable news sources. If no such court decision is made, or if courts consistently rule against such a pause, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question is specifically about court decisions regarding a pause, not about the administration's attempts to implement a pause without court approval.

A 'major' DVD rental company is defined as one with a significant market presence and nationwide operations in the United States. The resolution is based on the company's formal exit from bankruptcy proceedings, not merely an announcement of intent or a plan to exit.
